title: Dream Team
description: Michael and Pam begin their first day as the Michael Scott Paper Company putting together the rest of the staff and trying to raise money.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [phone ringing] You gonna answer that, Kev?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Oh, right. Thanks. [reading off index card] Dunder Mifflin, this is Kevin. Please hold while I transfer you. [cupping the mouthpiece, yelling] Oscar, your mom!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Charles is having Kevin cover the phones for a while. How do I say this diplomatically? [pause] I think Kevin is doing exactly as well as anyone might have expected someone like him to perform in a position like that.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Please hold. [cupping mouthpiece and holding out the phone] Andy! Phone call.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No. [Andy gets up from his desk] Stay there. Kev, thought we nailed the whole transfer thing earlier.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Yeah, I wrote it on my hand... but then I washed it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: It is transfer, extension, and then transfer again.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Okay. Andy, get ready. [muttering] Transfer. Extension. Transfer.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Here we go. [Meredith's phone rings. Jim and Andy groan.]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Oh, man!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: It is 1-3-4, Kev! [Kevin runs to the phone]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Kev, c'mon.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hustle!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Hold it.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You are murdering the Nard-dog!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [on phone] This is Kevin. Please hold and I will transfer you. [Phyllis's phone rings]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: You're bad at this too!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [running to the phone] Just... don't answer that call!

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Just transfer the damn call.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Your call is very important to us. Ple-[Andy's phone rings]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Hey-o! [applauding and cheering]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Way to go.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: My maid died.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Today is my first day at my new job at Michael Scott Paper Company Incorporated. You know, Apple Computers started in a garage. And we're starting in a condo. So we already have a leg up on Apple. [picks up piece of mail] Look, it's official! [door opens, Michael is in a bath robe]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, good. My hooker's here. [laughs] Hi.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Michael, you were expecting me, right?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes I was. Yes I was.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Are you wearing anything under the robe?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That is inappropriate, Pam. Come on in.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: This looks great, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Thank you. Would you like some french toast?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yes, please.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What shape?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: ... Square is fine.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Alright.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.text: Just want to fill you in on a few details. As you know, I will be running the branch while we search for Michael's replacement. So please feel free to come to me with any questions or concerns. [Kelly raises hand] Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Where will you be staying while you're in Scranton?

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.text: Eh, uh, in a hotel.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Charles, where were you born?

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.text: Actually, I meant questions more about the day-to-day operations of the company. Kay. [Andy raises hand] Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: How are operations of the company? Just, day-to day.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.text: Okay, let's go over non-discretionary cuts. Okay, guys? [Charles sees Stanley with his crossword, Charles stares and he puts it away] Thank you. So, umm...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [whispering] Would you please stop that?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You're breathing very heavily.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: This is how I breathe.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No it's not.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: If you want to tell me -

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.text: Okay, Jim Halpert. I need your eyes up front.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh no. I was just -

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.text: No. Hey, hey. I just want to hear "yes".

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: ... Yes.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.text: Good. As I was saying...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh no! The new boss does not find Jim adorable! Ohhhh! [smiles]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: So, what do you say we get started?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: After breakfast.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I'm full.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So how you feeling about the new company?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I feel good. [sees a huge pile of French toast] Wow.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You excited? About the new company?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah. I'm excited to start the company.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: After breakfast.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: We did that. So, what's next? Michael, just stop for a second. [reaches out to take the whisk] Michael. Stop for a second.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, I'm whipping them.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, I know you are.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Just let go.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Just let me have... Oh.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Let go, please. Just gimmee -

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Fine! [eggs splatter all over his robe] Oh, I'm sorry. I'm sorry.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I can't do this! This is pathetic, isn't it? I am such an idiot. I gave up the only job I ever loved to do this? I have egg in my Crocs.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: I never see him drink. I never see him eat.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: I don't think he even uses the bathroom.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Oh, he does. He does.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [doing situps] I feel weak today. Felt much stronger yesterday. Like Benjamin Button in reverse.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You know, Michael. When I feel overwhelmed -

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'm not overwhelmed, Pam.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I know! No, I'm saying that when I feel overwhelmed, something I like to do is make a list. Make a list of things to do and then start with the easy stuff.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Whatever calms you down.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay, first, work out. And, hey! Look! You did that. Check. [Michael doing leg lifts] Eat an enormous breakfast. Check.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Don't patronize me, Pam.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I think you should get dressed.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'm not getting dressed. I'm not getting dressed. I have too many things to do before I get dressed. I need to find a hundred clients.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Michael, that seems impossible.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It's totally impossible!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: We need to come up with one realistic thing that we could do today.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Assemble a sales team. A dream team.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Great.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, Ryan.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No. What? Why?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: He's everything I'm not and everything I am. He's the whole package.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No. We're not gonna hire Ryan.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Umm... Oh! Vikram! Best salesman I've ever met.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: He worked at that telemarketing place.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: We'll find him.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay. Oh also, we have a meeting this afternoon with a potential investor.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: We have an investor already?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Maybe. Barbara Keebis. She invests in local businesses. And I am putting together a little presentation for her.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Michael, that's fantastic.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, I guess it's not so bad. Got a few things cookin'. [sits down in robe, legs spread wide] Umm...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey! We need to get you dressed!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I have doubts about this too. But when one person freaks out, sometimes it weirdly makes the other one calmer. That's one thing I've learned about relationships. I hate that I just used the word relationship. [Michael comes out in a suit] Hey! You look great! [checks something off her list] Let's go!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Alright.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [laughing at something on his computer]

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.text: You a soccer fan?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Oh. Oh my God. I'm so embarrassed. You weren't supposed to see this. This is like my secret obsession.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.text: Well, that makes two of us.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: No way!

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I hate soccer. But guess who doesn't hate soccer? Charles Miner.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.text: I was actually in Germany for the 2006 World Cup Finals.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Ahhh. You bastard! That shoulda been me!

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.text: Yeah, I love the sport. I love the sport. Alright, man.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Cool!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I've never been a kiss up. I - it's just not how I operate. I mean, I've always subscribed to the idea that if you really want to impress your boss, you go in there and you do mediocre work. Half-heartedly.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Next on the list - open the mail.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh. Wow. "Michael Scott Paper Company." Okay. Very official. "Dear Mr. Scott. Please be advised that it is in violation of your condominium agreement to conduct a business headquartered in your residence. The penalty, a forfeiture of residence."

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, okay. It's fine. It's fine. We're just gonna add "find office"...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: How are we gonna find an office? How can we pay for an office?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Next on the list --  song parodies.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay. Okay. "Achey Breaky Fart."

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Great. Let's sing it in the car.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No! No No. No. "My Stumps." Like "My Humps" but a guy with no legs.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: We can do this.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: We can do this.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Whoa! And he just goes, "Boom". [kicking motion] Goal!

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.text: Yep. Yep. That's Pele.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You know your soccer, man.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.text: I know. Yes I do.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: I prefer [looks down at palms] Maradona. Uhhh... Diego Maradona.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.text: Oh yeah?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: From Argentina.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.text: I didn't know we had so many, uh, soccer fans in the office.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I mean, to be fair, I was the first one to talk about it, but...

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.text: What about you, Jim? You a fan of the game?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Uh, no. Nope. Not really.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.text: Well, it's not for everybody I suppose. [Andy laughs]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: It's 'cause I'm more of a player.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.text: Yeah?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You bet.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Really, Jim? I had no idea you played soccer. 'Cause you never, ever talk about it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well I do.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Wow.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I play.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You can be so modest sometimes.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, maybe you should get back to work.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Maybe you and Charles should kick the soccer ball around.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Maybe we will someday.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Maybe you will tonight after work. What do you say?

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.text: That's a great idea, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Great ideas are just part of what I bring to the table.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I don't try and be anything that I'm not.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.text: What do you say, Jim? Huh? Wanna play some soccer?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Jim, what do you say?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Sounds fun.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I'm in it to win.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Game on!

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.text: Okay. See you on the field, there, bro.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Let's... eh... see ya.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.text: See you on the field. Ha, ha. I can't wait!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yep, I used to play soccer in school. From second to fourth grade. I was on the orange team.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [Michael comes out with Vikram, arms raised] We got Vikram!

quotes.speaker: Vikram
quotes.text: You got me.

quotes.speaker: Vikram
quotes.text: Where are we going?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: We have a meeting with an investor today.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes we do. So, get excited. But I have to go the bathroom real quick. If you'll excuse me, be right back. [gets out of the car] Ah, okay.

quotes.speaker: Vikram
quotes.text: He seems really confident.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: He can be.

quotes.speaker: Vikram
quotes.text: Confidence. It's the food of the wise man but the liquor of the fool.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hm. I'm looking forward to getting to know you better, Vikram.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey. I would like a pair of size nine, please. [Ryan is working at the bowling alley] It's Michael.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I'm swamped, Michael. [over the PA] Happy birthday to Sally in lane 27.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, imagine a company that has no memory of your past misconduct because they have no files.

quotes.speaker: Vikram
quotes.text: He's taking a long time. Is it possible he's bowling? I mean, you know him better than I do.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yes. Yes, it's possible.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, it has always been a lifelong dream.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Michael! What's going on?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey, Ryan.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Hey, you.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Excuse me. Yes?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: This wasn't on the list.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, it is.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It's not.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It is.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [looks at list] When did you add this to the list?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Pam. Everyone deserves a second second chance. [walks back to Ryan] Ryan, just out of curiosity, how much do you get paid here?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Sixty thousand dollars a year.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You get paid by the year at the bowling alley?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: What do you make, secretary?

quotes.speaker: Supervisor
quotes.text: Back to work, shoe bitch!

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I told you guys, I'm really busy here, so...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Would you like to come to work for the Michael Scott Paper Company?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: What size shoes are you guys?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uh, nine.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: What are those, a men's ten?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [Ryan grabs some shoes] Look what he's doing.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What is he doing?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: He's stealing them. Okay, okay.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh my God.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: He's already paying for himself.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Sorry!

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Where is it?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Right here.

quotes.speaker: Vikram
quotes.text: Hey, c'mon, guys. These are prime selling hours, you know.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.text: Miner - [kicking a piece of trash]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, there he goes.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.text: ...sees his partner -

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yikes.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.text: Halpert. He looks up!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Aw, man.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.text: Defending duo! He sets him up! [Jim moves the piece of trash with his hands] He sets him up. Yeah. Oh-ho!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh! Goal!

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.text: Aw, man, I can't wait to play with you.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Aw, it's gonna be the [softly] worst.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Do you guys want to hear about Thailand?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh yeah.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Sure.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: It was indescribable.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Sounds awesome.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Beat.

quotes.speaker: Vikram
quotes.text: What sort of investing club is this?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Vikram, you ask a lot of questions and I like that. Hey, Nana! Hi!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [mouthing to camera] Nana?

quotes.speaker: Nana
quotes.text: Michael!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: People turn to their families all the time when they need help starting out and if my Nana's investment club can help the Michael Scott Paper Company become a reality, then I'm sure that's what she would have wanted. Does want.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well I'm sure that you must all have very, very busy schedules, so I appreciate you meeting with us here today. What this is is a business that I have worked toward my entire life. Hey! [snaps in front of sleeping old man] I have assembled what I believe to be the most exciting, sought-after talent in the industry today. Ladies and gentlemen, I present to you the dream team. From our very own Scranton, Pennsylvania - Pam Beesly. Pretty Pam is always reaching for the stars and someday, she may just surprise us all and grab one. Meet Vikram. From his humble beginnings as a - stay standing - from his humble beginnings as a prominent surgeon, he risked it all to become the most successful telemarketer in the lipophedrene industry. And do not call it a comeback. The youngest vice president in the history of Dunder Mifflin, and recent bowling alley employee, Ryan Howard is about to make a splash in paper.

quotes.speaker: Nana
quotes.text: So let's hear it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay. I have spent the last 15 years learning the ins and outs of the paper industry. With a lean, mean fighting crew and low overhead, I think I can perform the same business at a much, much higher rate of profit.

quotes.speaker: Nana
quotes.text: How do you expect to turn a profit in this economy?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: By wanting it more. By working hard-

quotes.speaker: Nana
quotes.text: What's your mission statement?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Mmmm-My mission is stated as follows:

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.text: C'mon, Oscar. What positions do people play?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Wing.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Wag.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.text: Jim. What do you play?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Left.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.text: Forward or half?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Forward, definitely.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.text: Okay, striker, huh?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Striker!

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.text: Let's see what you got in those legs!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Alright! Let's do it.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.text: Alright. [Dwight blows whistle in Jim's face] No, no, no. That's supposed to be the kickoff.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Kickoff. [to camera] My strategy is to touch the ball as little as possible. Chalk it up to teamwork. [to team] Alright! [clapping]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And I offer same day, free delivery.

quotes.speaker: Nana
quotes.text: Michael, I don't know about this.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Nana. [softly] I really think that Papa would want you to do this.

quotes.speaker: Nana
quotes.text: I'm not so sure.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well what is it exactly? I mean, what, what specifically? We don't - it doesn't have to be paper. We could sell medicine and other...

quotes.speaker: Nana
quotes.text: See, this is what concerns me.

quotes.speaker: Old Woman
quotes.text: We could just give him a chance. It's not much money.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well... this might not be the right time, but I need more than I originally asked for.

quotes.speaker: Nana
quotes.text: This isn't a handout club. It's an investment club!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Nana
quotes.text: I love you, Michael. I do.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Nana
quotes.text: But no. I mean it. No.

quotes.speaker: Vikram
quotes.text: I thought Nana raised some good questions. What kind of a name is Nana?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It means grandmother.

quotes.speaker: Vikram
quotes.text: Oh, sweet Jesus. Look, I'm sorry to do this, but can you drop me back at the telemarketing building?

quotes.speaker: Vikram
quotes.text: You know, Michael? You want to succeed? You got to apply the same- [Michael slams door]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Get 'im, Jim! C'mon, tough D, Jim. [Charles kicks, ball hits Phyllis in the nose]

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.text: Oh, my God! Oh wow. Jim, what the?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Phyllis, Phyllis.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.text: Phyllis, are you okay? Are, you okay?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: [muffled] No, I swallowed a crown.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.text: Why'd you duck, Jim?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah, Jim. Why would an experienced soccer player like yourself duck at the very last moment?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay, I'm just gonna go get some ice.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.text: Does that make you feel better? Huh?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I'm sorry, Phyllis.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.text: Oh, yeah. Jim's sorry.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Do you get TNT? The station? Do you get TNT?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah. I have cable and satellite as a backup. [to Pam] Yeah, I know. Two not-so-great things in a row. Ehhhh, well. Stuff happens, right? At least we got Ryan. The Rye-guy. We should call him Rye bread. We don't have to call him that. Unless you like it. We could call him that.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I can't do this.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What's that?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I can't do this. I had a real job. I sat ten feet away from my fiance. I had health benefits. I was just feeling impulsive. I should have gotten a tiny tattoo on my ankle.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Blech.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I just keep getting bored. And I let things build up and build up and then I - I, I do something too big, like this. Who does this?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well you know what? My mom always used to say that average people are the most special people in the world. And that's why God made so many.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: We don't have any money. We don't have an office. We don't have anything.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well we  should make a list. Lists are good. Lists are good. Lists are good. First on the list, let's get you out of the car. Alright. [Pam tosses list out car window] Okay...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: How come out of everyone in the office, I'm the only one that went with you? Is it because I'm that stupid? I mean, your own grandmother doesn't even believe in you!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I want you to listen to me. Because I want to tell you the situation that we are both in right now, kay? You quit your job. I quit my job. We both quit. Those are the facts. That's what happened. Now, what are our choices right now? Because you know, kiddo, you quit.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So what are our options? Well, we can start this paper company. We can try. Or... that's it. That's our only option. Because we quit. Pam, I do my best work when people don't believe in me. I remember in high school, my math teacher told me I was gonna flunk out. And know what I did? The very next day I went out and I scored more goals than anyone else in the history of the hockey team. See what I mean? I thrive on this. I thrive on it. So I'm gonna go inside. I'm going to make some calls, I'm gonna get us an office space, and I'm going to show you why you joined this company. Okay? [Pam nods]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You gotta have some extra space. Philly, work with me here. There's gotta be some sort of secret office that you have... lurkin' around... some awesome, free, keep it off the books... Oh, no. Not there. That would be humiliating.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I did what I had to do. I stepped in. I took charge. That's what being a man is. And earlier today, I was freaking out. Pam stepped up.  She was the man. Don't think a woman can be a man? Well, then that's your stereotype, not mine.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [walks into room] Okay.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I could work here. I could see this.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It's right in the middle of the paper belt.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Are you good?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, I'm good. You good?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I'm good.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know what they say, keep your friends close. [pointing to office sign where "Dunder Mifflin" is listed right above "Michael Scott Pap"]

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.text: Michael, you're back.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, I am, Charles.

quotes.speaker: Charles
quotes.text: Mmmhmm.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Except this time, you have no legal right to kick me out, because I have started my very own paper company right here in the building. If I were you, Charles Miner, I would watch your step. Because the Michael Scott Paper Company is about to open a big ol' can of whoopass on Dunder Mifflin. [Pam and Michael stare him down, he walks away] Actually a six pack. We're gonna open a six pack of whoopass. He looks scared.
